ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course is an exploration of the embodied experience of war.

I would absolutely recommend taking this course.I would summarize this as a course that approaches the history of warfare from a multifaceted perspective. Because of their subject matter, the readings can be emotionally difficult to get through at times, you come away with a new understanding of the individual as s/he exists in warfare, a topic that absolutely deserves more attention.
Take it. It exposes you to war histories in a way no one else, not even Winter or Blight, can.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course has helped me to gain a broader perspective of the historiography of the period I study. I now understand more of what was going on not only in my particular area of research, but also the surrounding context. I now feel like I am able to better situate what happened within my particular focus as well within other parts of Europe and the United States.
